subject: Web3
title: DeFi and Regulatory Gray Zones
description: A quick win: understand DeFi and Regulatory Gray Zones.

hook.text: DeFi protocols have no CEO, no office, and no compliance department. Regulators struggle with who to hold responsible.

buildup.text: Uniswap processes billions in trades. It's run by smart contracts with no human intermediary approving transactions.

discovery.text: Regulators are targeting front-end operators and developers. If you built the interface, you might be liable.

twist.text: Some DeFi protocols are genuinely decentralized. Others use 'decentralization' as a label while a small team controls everything.

climax.text: Regulating DeFi requires rethinking who is responsible when software runs autonomously. Law hasn't caught up yet.

punchline.text: No CEO, no office, no compliance team. Regulators are asking: who do we sue?

quiz.question: Why is regulating DeFi protocols difficult?
options: They have no centralized entity, CEO, or compliance department to hold accountable
